Emo.description: High emotional sensitivity, strong empathy feedback loop; reacts swiftly to group mood swings; used to monitor collective emotional waves.

Rea.description: Low impulse-control threshold; quick to act under stress; designed for crisis-response simulations; reveals how sudden decisions affect controlled environments.

Soc.description: Highly extroverted and persuasive; excels at networking and influence; key to studying opinion spread, crowd dynamics, and viral communication.

Log.description: Predominantly rational and composed; excels at structured decision-making and calculations; serves as a stabilizing baseline in behavioral experiments.

Inw.description: Low external energy and visibility; blends into background populations; useful for studying observer bias and unnoticed anomaly detection in simulations.

Cor.description: High and stable life-energy baseline; balanced across emotional, reactive, and social traits; represents the laboratoryâ€™s ideal equilibrium model for sustaining the controlled world.
